page.title: 08ECOLOGY OF AREA
page.content: Most of the land is farmland with some woodland.Most of the woodland belong to private estates and is protected.The texture of the soil is predominantly gravel and clay. There are several small nurseries selling flowers,plants and shrubs.The largest being Efford Experimental Station. Recent years have seen the building of a number of large housing developments after nine years at least of building restriction.The restriction was imposed because of inadequate sewage disposal.The industry in the area is mostly light and pollution as a result is minimal. The area is covered by the Wiltshire and Dorest Bus Service.There is an hourly bus service to the neighbouring towns.The majority of the public are car owners.
